snippet: After years of complaints, the league announced fines for players who repeatedly try to fool officials into calling fouls.
abstract: National Basketball Association announces that it will institute an anti-flopping policy this season, enforced by fines and a dose of public shame; flopping will not be called as an infraction during games, but will be determined afterward by video review; a player will be given a warning for his first offense and will receive monetary fines for subsequent offenses; count will be reset for playoffs, just as it does for technical and flagrant fouls.
lead_paragraph: After years of complaints, the league announced fines for players who repeatedly try to fool officials into calling fouls.

headline.seo: N.B.A. Unveils Policy to Get Floppers to Clean Up Act
headline.main: N.B.A. Outlines Policy to Try to Stop Flopping
headline.print_headline: N.B.A. Unveils a Policy to Stop the Flopping
